arabicText: ۞ قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “Did	 I	 not	 tell	 you	 that	 you	 will	
never	be	able	to	patiently	stay	with	me?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā meiñ	 ne	 āap	 se	 na	Kahā	 tha	 ke	 āap	
hargiz	mere	sāth	na	thaher	sakeñ	ge.

arabicText: قَالَ إِن سَأَلْتُكَ عَن شَىْءٍۭ بَعْدَهَا فَلَا تُصَـٰحِبْنِى ۖ قَدْ بَلَغْتَ مِن لَّدُنِّى عُذْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Said	 Moosa,	 “If	 I	 ask	 you	 anything	 after	
this,	 do	 not	 stay	 with	 me;	 indeed	 your	
condition	from	me	is	fulfilled.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	 us	 ke	 b’ad	 maiñ	 tum	 se	 kuchh	
pooñchhuñ	to	phir	mere	sāth	na	rahnā	beshak		meri	ṭaraf	se	tumhāra	'uzr	poora	ho	
chuka

arabicText: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَتَيَآ أَهْلَ قَرْيَةٍ ٱسْتَطْعَمَآ أَهْلَهَا فَأَبَوْا۟ أَن يُضَيِّفُوهُمَا فَوَجَدَا فِيهَا جِدَارًۭا يُرِيدُ أَن يَنقَضَّ فَأَقَامَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ لَوْ شِئْتَ لَتَّخَذْتَ عَلَيْهِ أَجْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	they	both	set	out	again;	until	they	came	
to	 the	 people	 of	 a	 dwelling	 – they	 asked	
its	people	for	food	- they	refused	to	invite	
them	– then	in	the	village	they	both	found	
a	 wall	 about	 to	 collapse,	 and	 the	 chosen	
bondman	 straightened	 it;	 said	 Moosa,	 “If	
you	 wished,	 you	 could	 have	 taken	 some	
wages	for	it!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	donoñ	chale	yahañ	tak	ke	jab	ek	gāoñ	
wāloñ	ke	pās	āaye	un	dehqāno	(kisāno)	se	
khāna	 māñga	 to	 unhoñ	 ne	 inheñ	 d’awat	
deni	 qabool	 na	 ki	 phir	 donoñ	 ne	 us	gāoñ	
meiñ	ek	diwār	pāyi	ke	gira	chahti	hai		us	
bande	ne	usey	sidha	kar	diya	Mūsā ne	Kahā	
tum	 chahte	 to	 us	 par	 kuchh	 mazdoori	 le	
lete

arabicText: قَالَ هَـٰذَا فِرَاقُ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنِكَ ۚ سَأُنَبِّئُكَ بِتَأْوِيلِ مَا لَمْ تَسْتَطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًا
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“This	is	 the	parting	between	you	
and	 me;	 I	 shall	 now	 tell	 you	 the	
interpretation	 of	 the	 matters	 you	 could	
not	patiently	bear.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	yeh		meri	aur	āpki	judāi	hai	ab	meiñ	
āap	ko	un		bātoñ	ka	pher		(bhed)	batauñ	ga	
jin	par	āap	se	sabr	na	ho	saka	.

arabicText: أَمَّا ٱلسَّفِينَةُ فَكَانَتْ لِمَسَـٰكِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ فَأَرَدتُّ أَنْ أَعِيبَهَا وَكَانَ وَرَآءَهُم مَّلِكٌۭ يَأْخُذُ كُلَّ سَفِينَةٍ غَصْبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“In	respect	of	the	boat	- it	belonged	to	the	
poor	people	who	worked	on	the	river,	so	I	
wished	to	flaw	it	- and	behind	them	was	a	
king	 who	 would	 capture	 every	 sound	
ship.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	kashti	thi	woh	kuchh	mohtājoñ	ki	
thi	ke	dariya	meiñ	kām	karte	they		to	meiñ	
ne	chāha	ke	usey	‘aibdār	kar	dooñ	aur	un	
ke	 pichhe	 ek	 bādshah	 tha	 ke	 har	 ṣābit	
kashti	zabardasti	chhin	leta	.

arabicText: وَأَمَّا ٱلْغُلَـٰمُ فَكَانَ أَبَوَاهُ مُؤْمِنَيْنِ فَخَشِينَآ أَن يُرْهِقَهُمَا طُغْيَـٰنًۭا وَكُفْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“And	 in	 respect	 of	 the	 boy	 - his	 parents	
were	Muslims	and	we	feared	that	he	may	
incite	them	to	rebellion	and	disbelief.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 woh	 jo	 ladka	 tha	 us	 ke	 māñ	 bāp	
Musalmān	 they	 	 to	 hameiñ	 dar	 huwa	 ke	
woh	un	ko	sarkashi	aur	kufr	par	chadhāwe.

arabicText: فَأَرَدْنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَهُمَا رَبُّهُمَا خَيْرًۭا مِّنْهُ زَكَوٰةًۭ وَأَقْرَبَ رُحْمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“So	 we	 wished	 that	 their	 Lord	 may	
bestow	 them	 a	 child	 - better,	 purer	 and	
nearer	to	mercy.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ham	ne	chāha	ke	un	donoñ	ka	Rab	us	se	
behtar	 suthrā aur	 us	 se	 ziyadah		
maherbāni	meiñ	qarib	‘aṭa		kare

arabicText: وَأَمَّا ٱلْجِدَارُ فَكَانَ لِغُلَـٰمَيْنِ يَتِيمَيْنِ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ وَكَانَ تَحْتَهُۥ كَنزٌۭ لَّهُمَا وَكَانَ أَبُوهُمَا صَـٰلِحًۭا فَأَرَادَ رَبُّكَ أَن يَبْلُغَآ أَشُدَّهُمَا وَيَسْتَخْرِجَا كَنزَهُمَا رَحْمَةًۭ مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۚ وَمَا فَعَلْتُهُۥ عَنْ أَمْرِى ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَأْوِيلُ مَا لَمْ تَسْطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. “And	in	respect	of	the	wall	- it	belonged	to	two	orphan	boys	of	the	city,	and	beneath	it	was	their	
treasure,	 and	 their	 father was	 a	 virtuous	 man;	 therefore	 your	 Lord	 willed	 that	 they	 should	
reach	their	maturity	and	remove	their	treasure;	by	the	mercy	of	your	Lord;	and	I	have	not	done	
this	at	my	own	command;	this	is	the	interpretation	of	the	matters	you	could	not	patiently	bear.”
(* Hazrat Khidr was given the knowledge of the hidden - as in all three explanations he gave).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Rahi	woh	diwār	woh	shaher	ke	do	yateem	ladkoñ	ki	thi	aur	us	ke	neeche	un	ka	khazana	tha	aur	
un	ka	bāp	nek	āadmi	tha	to	āap	ke	Rab	ne	chāha	ke	woh	donoñ	apni	jawāni	ko	pahuñcheñ	aur	
apna	khazāna	nikāleñ	āap	ke	Rab	ki	Rahmat	se	aur	yeh	kuchh	maiñ	ne	apne	hukm	se	na	kiya	yeh		
fay’r (bhay’d)	hai	un	bātoñ	kā	jis	par	āapse		sabr	na	ho	saka.

arabicText: وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَن ذِى ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ ۖ قُلْ سَأَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْكُم مِّنْهُ ذِكْرًا
englishTranslationText: And	they	ask	you	regarding	Zul-Qarnain;	say,	“I	shall	recite	his	story	to	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	se	Zulqarnaiñ se	poochhte	haiñ	tum	farmāo	maiñ	tumheñ	us	ka	mazkoor	padh	kar	sunāta	
hooñ.

arabicText: إِنَّا مَكَّنَّا لَهُۥ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ سَبَبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	gave	him	authority	in	the	land	
and	 bestowed	 him	 the	 means	 of	
everything.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Ham	ne	usey	zameen	meiñ	qābu	
diya	aur	har	chiz	ka	ek	sāmān	‘aṭa		farmāya
.To	woh	ek	sāmān	ke	piche	chala.

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَغْرِبَ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَغْرُبُ فِى عَيْنٍ حَمِئَةٍۢ وَوَجَدَ عِندَهَا قَوْمًۭا ۗ قُلْنَا يَـٰذَا ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ إِمَّآ أَن تُعَذِّبَ وَإِمَّآ أَن تَتَّخِذَ فِيهِمْ حُسْنًۭا
englishTranslationText:
To	 the	 extent	 that	 when	 he	 reached	 the	
setting-place	 of	 the	 sun,	 he	 found	 it	
setting	 in	 a	 muddy	 spring,	 and	 found	 a	
nation	 there;	 We	 said, “O	 Zul-Qarnain	 –
either	punish	them	or	choose	kindness	for	
them.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yahañ	 tak	 ke	 jab	 sooraj	 doobne	 ki	 jagah	
pahuñcha	 usey	 ek	 siyah	 kichad	 ke	
chashme	meiñ	doobta	pāyā	aur	wahañ	ek	
qoum	mili	ham	ne	farmāya	aey	ƶulqarnaiñ!	
yā	 to	 unheñ	 saza	 de	 yā	 un	 ke	 sāth	 bhalāi	
ikhtiyār	kar.

arabicText: قَالَ أَمَّا مَن ظَلَمَ فَسَوْفَ نُعَذِّبُهُۥ ثُمَّ يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ فَيُعَذِّبُهُۥ عَذَابًۭا نُّكْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	 submitted,	 “Regarding	 one	 who	 has	
done	injustice,	we	shall	soon	punish	him	–
he	will	 then	be	brought	back	 to	his	Lord,	
Who	will	punish	him	severely.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Árz	ki	ke	woh	jis	ne	ẓulm	kiya	usey	to	ham	
án-qareeb	 saza	 deñ	 ge	 phir	 apne	 rab	 ki	
ṭaraf	phera	jāyega		woh	ise	buri	mār	dega.

arabicText: وَأَمَّا مَنْ ءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَلَهُۥ جَزَآءً ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۖ وَسَنَقُولُ لَهُۥ مِنْ أَمْرِنَا يُسْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. “And	regarding	one	who	believed	and	did	
good	 deeds	 – so	 his	 reward	 is	 goodness;	
and	 we	 shall	 soon	 give	 him	 an	 easy	
command.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	Imān lāya	aur	nek	kām	kiya	to	uska	
badla	bhalāi	hai	aur	'an-qareeb	ham	usey		
āasān	kām	kaheñ	ge	.
Phir	ek	sāmān	ke	pichhe	chala

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَطْلِعَ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَطْلُعُ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍۢ لَّمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُم مِّن دُونِهَا سِتْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
To	 the	 extent	 that	 when	 he	 reached	 the	
rising-place	 of	 the	 sun,	 he	 found	it	 rising	
upon	a	nation	 for	which	We	had	not	kept	
any	shelter from	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yahañ	 tak	 ke	 jab	 sooraj	 nikalne	 ki	 jagah	
pahuñcha	usey	aisi	qoum	par	nikalta	pāya	
jin	 ke	liye	 ham	 ne	 sooraj	 se	 koi	ādh	 nahi	
rakhi.

arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ وَقَدْ أَحَطْنَا بِمَا لَدَيْهِ خُبْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. So	it	is;	and	Our	knowledge	encompasses	
all	that	he	possessed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bāt	yahi	hai	aur	jo	kuchh	us	ke	pās	tha	sab	
ko	hamara	'ilm	muhiṭ hai.
